item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Marlena De Blasi
item.description: "Living as a couple never means that each gets half. You must take turns at giving more than getting. It’s not the same as a bow to the other whether to dine out rather than in, or which one gets massaged that evening with oil of calendula; there are seasons in the life of a couple that function, I think, a little like a night watch. One stands guard, often for a long time, providing the serenity in which the other can work at something. Usually that something is sinewy and full of spines. One goes inside the dark place while the other one stays outside, holding up the moon." -- Marlena De Blasi

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Rachel Cohn
item.description:
"There is no such thing as a soulmate…and who would want there to be? I don’t want half of a shared soul. I want my own damn soul.”
Ely in <I>Naomi and Ely’s No Kiss List</I> Rachel Cohn and David Levithan" -- Rachel Cohn

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Buffy the Vampire Slayer writers
item.description: "Buffy Summers: (to Spike) "I could NEVER be your girl!" -- Buffy the Vampire Slayer writers

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Anne Lamott
GraceAnne add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Peace is joy at rest. Joy is peace on its feet. quoting her pastor in Salon, April 25, 2003" -- Anne Lamott

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Daniel Pennac
item.description: "A well-chosen book saves you from everything, including yourself." -- Daniel Pennac

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Frances O'Roark Dowell
item.description: "He was a big talker, someone who liked words for words' sake, the sound of them, the way you can pile them up in your mouth and make a poem if you speill them out the right way. p92" -- Frances O'Roark Dowell

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by George Steiner
item.description: "the calling of the teacher. There is no craft more privileged. To awaken in another human being powers, dreams beyond one’s own; to induce in others a love for that which one loves; to make of one’s inward present their future; that is a threefold adventure like no other." -- George Steiner

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Marlena De Blasi
item.description: "Some people are born empty. All manner of good deeds and patience and loving kindness can't even begin to fill them up." -- Marlena De Blasi

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Gale is mine. I am his. Anything else is unthinkable." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "This is. And thou art. There is no safety. There is no end. The word must be heard in silence. There must be darkness to see the stars. The dance is always danced above the hollow place, above the terrible abyss." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "When action grows unprofitable, gather information; when information grows unprofitable, sleep." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Dorothy L. Sayers
item.description: "Time and trouble will tame an advanced young woman, but an advanced old woman is uncontrollable by any earthly force." -- Dorothy L. Sayers

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Kobayashi Issa
item.description: "Summer night-- even the stars are whispering to each other." -- Kobayashi Issa

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by John Cheever
item.description: "I can’t write without a reader. It’s precisely like a kiss—you can’t do it alone." -- John Cheever

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Octavia Butler
item.description: "In order to rise From its own ashes A phoenix First Must Burn." -- Octavia Butler

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Ogden Nash
item.description: "Tonight’s December thirty-first, Something is about to burst. The clock is crouching, dark and small, Like a time bomb in the hall. Hark, it's midnight, children dear. Duck! Here comes another year!" -- Ogden Nash

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "My brother has his sword, King Robert has his warhammer and I have my mind...and a mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone if it is to keep its edge. That's why I read so much Jon Snow." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Augustine of Hippo
item.description: "The truth is like a lion; you don’t have to defend it. Let it loose; it will defend itself." -- Augustine of Hippo

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Norman Maclean
item.description: "Eventually, all things merge into one, and a river runs through it." -- Norman Maclean

item.title: GraceAnne add a quote by Keith Richards
item.description: "When you are growing up there are two institutional places that affect you most powerfully: the church, which belongs to God, and the public library, which belongs to you." -- Keith Richards
